intro: Ceropegia montiphila, commonly known as the Cape mountain ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pale green or yellowish and are adapted for specific pollinators. Ceropegia montiphila is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ease of care.
